title.rendered: McGill University MacBain 2024 Scholarships for International Students – Canada

content.rendered:
Are you ready to embark on an exceptional academic journey in Canada? The prestigious McCall MacBain Scholarships at McGill University are now accepting applications for the 2024 intake. This fully-funded scholarship opportunity is designed to support outstanding prospective candidates in pursuing their master’s or professional programs.

Contents on This Page

Toggle

  • Aim and Benefits of McCall MacBain Masters Scholarship
    • Duration and Reward

The McCall MacBain scholarship goes beyond covering your tuition fees. It provides comprehensive financial support, including living stipends to cover your day-to-day expenses while you focus on your studies. If you need to relocate to Montréal, worry not! The scholarship also offers financial assistance to help ease the transition.

One of the remarkable aspects of the McCall MacBain Scholarship is the extensive support system it provides. As a recipient, you will have access to experienced mentors, coaches, and advisors who will guide and support you throughout your academic journey. This program is not only dedicated to developing your leadership skills but also encourages you to explore your passions and broaden your horizons.

The application process is now open for the 2024 cohort. The McCall MacBain Scholarships will select up to 20 exceptional candidates from Canada (citizens, permanent residents, and refugees) and 10 candidates from around the world to join the esteemed group of scholars for the 2024 academic year.

As an applicant for the McCall MacBain Scholarship, you also become eligible for additional awards. Through the interview process, candidates who showcase exceptional qualities and stand out will have the opportunity to receive one of the approximately 100 regional and finalist awards.

Don’t miss out on this life-changing opportunity to study at McGill University with the support of the McCall MacBain Scholarships. Start your application today and pave the way for a transformative educational experience in Canada.

McCall MacBain Masters Scholarship

  • Type: Postgraduate
  • Organisation: McCall MacBain Scholarships
  • Country to study: Canada
  • School to study: McGill University
  • Course to studyNot specified
  • State of Origin
  • Gender: Men and Women
  • Application Deadline: August 24, 2024

Aim and Benefits of McCall MacBain Masters Scholarship

Duration and Reward

  • As a McCall MacBain Scholar, you’ll be able to pursue a fully funded master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill University.
  • The scholarship covers tuition and fees for the full normal duration of the master’s or professional program, a living stipend of $2,000 CAD per month during academic terms, and a relocation grant for moving to Montréal.
  • As a McCall MacBain Scholarship applicant, you are eligible for additional awards. All other applicants, including U.S. applicants, are eligible for 20 International Finalist Awards ($20,000)
  • As part of a cohort of scholars from different fields, you’ll participate in an intensive leadership development curriculum, including seminars with case studies, to help you better tackle complex challenges and deepen your impact.
  • Every scholar is matched with a supportive and experienced mentor, a professional coach, and advisors.
  • In addition to developing your leadership skills, you’ll have opportunities to expand your knowledge and feed your curiosity.

>Read More: Apply for UK Government GREAT Scholarships at University of Manchester 2024

Requirements for McCall MacBain Masters Scholarship Qualification

To be considered for the McCall and MacBain Scholarships, you must satisfy the following:

  • You can apply for the McCall MacBain Scholarship in 2024 if you are planning to apply for Summer/Fall 2024 admission to a full-time master’s or second-entry professional undergraduate program at McGill University.
  • The program must consist of 45 credits or more and take place primarily on McGill’s downtown or Macdonald campuses.
  • Applicants must meet the minimum degree and language requirements for McGill master’s program admission.
  • You must have a bachelor’s degree or its recognized equivalent, or be on track to complete it by August 2024.

How to Apply

Interested and qualified? Go to McCall MacBain Scholarships on apply.mccallmacbainscholars.org to apply

You must apply separately and be admitted to an eligible graduate program at McGill University. You should review your desired program’s admission requirements, including but not limited to GPA, well in advance.

  • Regional interviews: October 12 – December 1, 2024
  • Classes begin: September 2024
